item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi üëã, I am Ankit Hans I am a ‚ú® Full Stack Developer, üíª Open Source enthusiast and I love building great and cool stuffs for the community. üôè Welcome to my Blog, Here I share my experiences with Software Developement Experience Google Summer of Code Student Developer @JBoss(Red Hat) (May 2021 ‚Äì present) Development of Charmil Framework Improve base framework (charmil) to Install a plugin CLI in the Host CLI Build and deploy registry with different versions of Kafka specific CLIs GitHub repo/pages based remote index servers for plugins which will contain docs, metadata, etc.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Here are some cool projects on which I worked upon. CodeX https://github.com/ankithans/codeX Compile and Run your program and convert it into pseudocode. And Pseudocode itself can be converted into 118 global languages. Convert your code into Flow Chart and generate realtime code suggestions to imporve code quality as per industry standards Share your code with teachers, friends or colleagues as a unique URL on a single click Tech Stack - python, reactjs, pylint, tailwindcss, fastAPI, googleTrans, hackerearth API, SQLite3, pyflowchart Note Worthy https://github.
